description: From Scots antrin, present participle of anter (“to adventure, venture”).

adjectives.description: antrin (comparative more antrin, superlative most antrin)

examples: But there was more to it than that, some never knew it, but real enough, an antrin magic that bound you in one with the mind, not only the body of a man, with his dreams and desires, his loves, even hates  […]
